intro: Calophanoides pubescens, commonly known as the hairy calophanoides, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. The botanical features of Calophanoides pubescens make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
